notesStmt.note: Scribe is Vināyaka Āḍiśekara son of Bālakṛṣṇabhaṭṭa (f. 2v).
Dated saṃvat 1860 (1803) (f. 2v); date is abbreviated as "saḥ" but should read saṃvat given that a śaka date of 1938 A.D. would post-date its inclusion in the Penn collection.
Mistakes blacked out; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout.

msContents.summary: Manuscript used for recitation or contemplation and is comprised of the full 50 verses of the love poem, loosely translated by B.S. Miller as Phantasies of a love thief, wherein a woman longs for her lost lover and the goddess Dūrgā.
